image.altText: an aerial photo of a gold mine.

props.synopsis: A Canadian gold miner has been fined $160,000 for conducting illegal exploration drilling at an Aboriginal sacred site, after the company's own press release tipped authorities off to the damage.

title.children: Judge fines gold mining company for 'mercenary' drilling at sacred site

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie, sitting at a desk inside an office with a view of Darwin Harbour.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption, Michael Riches, has resigned from his role, the NT chief minister has announced.

title.children: NT ICAC commissioner Michael Riches resigns suddenly

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman wearing a red blazer and black top, delivering a speech in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory opposition leader has delivered her first budget reply speech, claiming the jurisdiction's future will be "bleak" under the government's prison-focused crime approach.

title.children: Opposition calls NT budget 'bleak' with 'delusional' solutions to crime

image.altText: A woman with long hair talks to waiting media outside a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Danielle Wilson is suing the Civil Aviation Safety Authority over her husband's death in a remote chopper crash. CASA blames the helicopter operator, which it says "did precisely what CASA said they couldn't".

title.children: Widow of Netflix star 'pleased' with court ruling after fatal helicopter crash

image.altText: An aerial view of Larrimah in the Northern Territory

props.synopsis: Indigenous people in the remote community of Jilkminggan fear their springs and creeks will be degraded as a new water licence allows for an 800-hectare irrigated cotton plantation.

title.children: Controversial water licence approved for cotton and hay around Larrimah

props.synopsis: It's an exclusive tourist destination and one of the most pristine places on the planet. It's the last place you would expect to find birds with bellies so full of plastic that they crunch if you squeeze them.

title.children: On this island the birds are so full of plastic they crunch

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: The Australian government continues to lobby for Dr Yang, who is imprisoned in China and has a cyst on one of his kidneys.

title.children: 'Tears blur my vision': Detained Yang thanks Australia as health declines

image.altText: Probowo Subianto and Anthony Albanese shake hands after signing guest book.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will be in Indonesia for just one day on his first trip overseas since winning his second term, but the visit still carries plenty of symbolic weight.

title.children: Albanese visit to Indonesia is quick but loaded with symbolic weight

image.altText: Two men wearing suits

props.synopsis: Russia has announced its delegation to discuss peace with Ukraine, with President Vladimir Putin's name notably absent.

title.children: Putin not listed in delegation for Ukraine peace talks, Trump not going

image.altText: A sketch shows Casandra Ventura wiping tears from her eye while in a witness dock in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs's former partner tells a New York court how he would allegedly threaten to release sex tapes to humiliate her and ruin her career.

title.children: Cassie accuses Diddy of rape and sex tape threats at trial

image.altText: Donald Trump pumping one closed fist in the air at the top of the stairs to Air Force One.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's visit to the Middle East is certainly sending shockwaves across the region, as the president outlines his vision for relations between the United States and Arab states.

title.children: Cybertrucks and a snub: 5 key moments from Trump's day in the Middle East

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Donald Trump shake hands and make eye contact

props.synopsis: The first trade deal struck following Donald Trump's tariff regime has drawn criticism from Beijing, which experts say is also a warning to other countries.

title.children: China sends 'loud and clear' warning over US-UK trade agreement

image.altText: SG-1 Fathom autonomous glider single

props.synopsis: The drone was demonstrated at HM Naval Base Portsmouth over the weekend in front of the Royal Navy's fleet commander.

title.children: Australian underwater AI drones could soon bolster UK naval surveillance

image.altText: Nvidia logo and rising stock graph

props.synopsis: Technology companies led gains in US trade, with Nvidia, Tesla and Alphabet among the best performers. ASX futures point to a dip at the open after a mixed finish on Wall St. Follow live.

title.children: Tech stocks continue to gain but Wall St ends mixed

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: New CEO for Treasury Wine Estates
Unemployment rate forecast to remain steady in April
Mortgage wars heating up ahead of RBA meeting

image.altText: David Mobbs and Kylie Truswell-Mobbs stand arm in arm with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: The son of a Queensland woman accused of murdering her terminally ill partner claims he confirmed with his father that he wanted to overdose, court documents show.

title.children: Woman tells investigators terminally ill partner allegedly 'begged her' to kill him, police affidavit reveals

image.altText: Man with grey beard and hat (Craig Eury) holds up rock with fossil tracks in it.

props.synopsis: Fossil footprints found in Victoria by amateur palaeontologists have pushed back our understanding of when an early relative of most land-based creatures first evolved.

title.children: 'Surreal' fossil discovery pushes origin of reptiles back 40 million years

image.altText: A mechanic with a car.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's election pledge for nuclear reactors caused deep divisions within the community of Port Augusta — now that it's been taken off the agenda, locals are looking towards different futures.

title.children: Nuclear off the table in Port Augusta, as locals look in other directions

image.altText: A man in a blue suit speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Tom Fletcher, a top UN aid chief, accused Israel of "deliberately" and "unashamedly" imposing inhumane conditions on civilians in Gaza — something which Israel denies.

title.children: UN Security Council urged to 'act now' and 'prevent genocide' in Gaza

image.altText: a group of First Nations models are dressed in Indigenous designed clothes smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Backstage at Fashion Week, First Nations designers and models take a moment to reflect on the importance of representation.

title.children: ‘If you're Indigenous, you're beautiful’: Representation in fashion

image.altText: A person holds a phone showing an avatar on a map.

props.synopsis: New research shows nearly one in five young adults believe tracking a partner's location is to be expected in a relationship.

title.children: Tracking partner through apps 'problematic' as research finds link to coercive control

image.altText: Dry conditions on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Farmers say while there may be patches of green in paddocks, conditions are much drier than usual. In some parts of Tasmania it's been the driest on record since the 1900s, according to the Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: Water restrictions for some in Tasmania as rain hard to come by

image.altText: Smiling bald man, wears pink, white striped shirt, has an ear speaker, a breathing tube over shoulder, phone strapped to hand.

props.synopsis: Modifications at school have helped David Deitz slip back into work, but he still cannot access many of the shops nearby. On Global Accessibility Awareness Day, he is urging businesses to do more.

title.children: Principal returns after cycling crash leaves him with quadriplegia

image.altText: A woman in a cap holds her hands out, filled with hazelnuts

props.synopsis: A family-run Tasmanian hazelnut farm that was reluctantly put up for sale last year has not only survived but thrived thanks to finding a market online.

title.children: Nut farmers crack business woes with online success

image.altText: Storm players celebrate with hugs after Ryan Papenhuyzen of the Storm scored a try

props.synopsis: Melbourne has described the NRL's decision to reject the Storm for next year's Las Vegas season launch as a "missed opportunity", saying the game is neglecting one of Australia's biggest sporting markets.

title.children: Storm surprised club not invited to NRL Las Vegas opener in 2026

image.altText: Head on shot of the L2 Circular Quay light rail tram

props.synopsis: With light rails under construction around the nation, the case brought by Sydney businesses against Transport for NSW in the High Court today could set a precedent for compensation claims.

title.children: Should government pay for business woes over Sydney's light rail?

image.altText: Lachie Schultz is helped by two trainers as he collapses

props.synopsis: The AFL is embroiled in a firestorm following the serious concussion sustained by Collingwood's Lachie Schultz, and the miscommunication that has followed.

title.children: How one concussion led to a saga forcing the AFL into a stunning backflip

image.altText: A blonde woman stands looking seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: Social service advocates are pleading for support for public housing tenants as residents express their fears after a spate of violent attacks and antisocial behaviour in the Perth suburb of Inglewood.

title.children: Antisocial behaviour sparks plea to help social housing tenants

image.altText: A woman with her mouth wide open in a parliament ripping a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, a parliamentary committee has handed down its punishment for the MPs who performed a haka on the chamber floor.

title.children: Māori Party MPs suspended over haka protest in NZ parliament

image.altText: Man's hands tape up a box when moving house.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors believe the men were contact with individuals working for Russian state institutions and planned to mail explosives to Ukraine.

title.children: German police arrest three men over alleged Russian parcel bomb plot

image.altText: Man walking past a glass window.

props.synopsis: A former Queensland mine operator is contesting allegations he failed to comply with a series of environmental requirements before the company he worked for collapsed.

title.children: Chinese investors controlled collapsed mining company's finances, court hears

image.altText: Red wood ants dismembering a blue ground beetle

props.synopsis: Sydneysiders will have the chance to see 100 awe-inspiring shots in the annual tour of the Wildlife Photographer of the Year exhibition later this month at the Australian National Maritime Museum.

title.children: Bilby photo that took 'years' to snap among epic shots in Sydney exhibit

image.altText: A woman and a man standing on a stage raise each other's hands

props.synopsis: As the final votes are tallied, here's how the results could shape the future of the Duterte and Marcos clans in the Philippines.

title.children: 'House of Marcos potentially sinking': Fallout from Philippine midterms

image.altText: A doctor writing a prescription.

props.synopsis: Gun owners in WA are required to have their doctor to sign off on their mental and physical fitness in order to hold a firearms licence, and that has GPs worried.

title.children: Doctors fear for their safety over new gun laws that requires GP mental health check

image.altText: Two women in white shirts smiling at each other in front of a beach

props.synopsis: Outdoor exercise groups surge in popularity as people look for low-intensity alternatives to keeping fit while staying social.

title.children: Run club isn't for you? Don't worry, there are alternatives
